title: Wheaties look to carry spark back home
text:
Wheaties look to carry spark back home By: Perry Bergson Enlarge Image 
Jayce Hawryluk: 4 goals, 1 assist on Saturday (FILE PHOTO) 
The Brandon Wheat Kings ended one drought on Saturday; on Tuesday they’ll be looking to halt another. 
The Wheat Kings scored four power-play goals as they beat the Regina Pats 6-0 Saturday at the Brandt Centre on a night in which 19-year-old forward Jayce Hawryluk had four goals and an assist. 
After losing twice to start the Western Hockey League season at Westman Place — although one came in a shootout — Wheat Kings head coach and general manager Kelly McCrimmon said they’ve played well on the road but haven’t won at home. 
"It’s very important that we play well on home ice," McCrimmon said. "We’ve had a shootout loss and a regulation loss in two games and rebounded on both Saturdays with real good games." 
The Wheat Kings entertain the Vancouver Giants on Tuesday at 7 p.m., with the Kootenay Ice in town on Friday and the Edmonton Oil Kings visiting on Saturday. The weekend games begin at 7:30 p.m. 
"I sure think that our team is ready to get busier," McCrimmon said. "The midweek game this week is, I think, going to be real good for us and then of course Friday and Saturday on the weekend so it will be the first week that we haven’t had Monday to Friday with practice." 
The Wheat Kings, who went 0-for-20 on the power play to start the Western Hockey League season, exploded for four goals with the man advantage on Saturday and one more that came two seconds after a power play ended. 
Hawryluk opened the scoring after an early Brandon power play had ended when he knocked in a rebound. Before the period ended, he had banged in two more rebounds on the power play for the natural hat trick. 
John Quenneville wired a shot in early in the second on another power play and Hawryluk added his fourth goal of the game, again with the man advantage, just over a minute later. 
Reid Duke made it 6-0 late in the second with a nice shot from the slot that he created off the rush. 
Jordan Papirny, making his fourth straight start of the young season, stopped 16 shots for his seventh career shutout. He had five last season. 
Quenneville ended up with a goal and two assists and Nolan Patrick had three assists. 
"I think we passed up some shots through three games so we did put more pucks on goal tonight," McCrimmon said. "I’m pleased with how little we gave up as well with only 16 shots against. That certainly goes a long way towards helping you be successful on the road." 
ICINGS: Wheat King F Rihards Bukarts has been suspended by the WHL for a dangerous hit from behind on Friday against the Calgary Hitmen that earned him a major and game misconduct. The length of the suspension hasn’t been determined … Brandon’s scratches were Bukarts, F Tim McGauley, F/D Quintin Lisoway, F Garrett Armour and D Dominic Thom as Brandon dressed just two overagers … Quenneville, Patrick and Tyler Coulter skated on a line together on Saturday … Former Wheat King F Taylor Cooper was among the scratches for the Pats. He continues to recover from off-season shoulder surgery. 
» pbergson@brandonsun.com
